description: HoneyDew is a web app that helps groups of friends schedule, organize, and execute home-improvement tasks together. Users create personal Honey-Do lists, join groups, set availability, and let AI suggest optimal meeting days. On execution day, they tackle tasks together with progress tracking, badges, and light gamification.

userStories.title: Project Setup & Authentication
userStories.description: Set up the HoneyDew web app project structure, database schema, and user authentication (signup/login with email or phone).
acceptanceCriteria: Next.js/React app initialized with TypeScript
Database schema includes Users, Groups, Tasks, Availability, GroupLists tables
Auth system allows signup with email and phone number
Users can log in and stay authenticated
Protected routes redirect unauthenticated users to login

userStories.title: User Onboarding & Profile Setup
userStories.description: As a new user, I want to see a witty intro, create my profile with name and phone number, grant contact permissions, and add my first task.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing screen shows 'Hey Honey, how do you dew?' message
Profile form captures name and phone number
Contact import flow requests and processes contacts
Onboarding walks user to create their first task
User can skip to group creation after first task

userStories.title: Create & Manage Personal Honey-Do List
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create tasks with name, description, and location so I can build my personal home-improvement list.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can add tasks with name, description, location (custom, recent, or common)
AI generates editable estimates for materials, time, and difficulty
Users can edit all fields including AI suggestions
Tasks display on a master list grouped by location
Users can edit or delete their own tasks
userStories.notes: Location dropdown should show common, recent, and custom options

userStories.title: Create or Join a Group
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create a new group or join an existing one with friends via phone number or invite link.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create a new group and set a group name
Users can join groups via phone number of group creator or invite link
Group page displays all members and their names
Users can see all group members' full task lists
Group creator can remove members
userStories.notes: Keep join flow simple for MVP

userStories.title: Set Weekly Availability
userStories.description: As a group member, I want to set my availability for each day of the week so the group can find the best time to meet.
acceptanceCriteria: Users see a one-week calendar view
Users can add/edit availability time slots for each day
Availability is saved and can be edited anytime
Group can view all members' availability at a glance
userStories.notes: Simple time slots (e.g., Morning, Afternoon, Evening) or specific times?

userStories.title: AI Suggests Optimal Meeting Day
userStories.description: As a group, I want AI to suggest the best day/time for everyone to meet based on our availability.
acceptanceCriteria: AI analyzes all members' availability and suggests the day with most overlap
Suggestion shows which members are available and any conflicts
Group sees a notification with the suggestion
Users can accept with 'Let's Dew This' button
userStories.notes: For MVP, simple majority logic (most people available wins)

userStories.title: Accept or Reject Meeting Suggestion
userStories.description: As a group member, I want to accept or reject the suggested meeting day and get a new suggestion if needed.
acceptanceCriteria: Users see 'Let's Dew This' (accept) and 'No Can Dew' (reject) buttons
Accepting locks in the meeting day/time
Rejecting triggers AI to suggest the next best option
Group sees confirmation when a day is locked in
userStories.notes: 'No Can Dew' is a fun callback to the app name

userStories.title: Group Chat for Coordination
userStories.description: As a group member, I want to message the group to discuss tasks and coordinate logistics.
acceptanceCriteria: Simple message thread in the group page
Users can send and view messages chronologically
Messages persist and load when users revisit the group
Notifications alert users to new messages
userStories.notes: Keep this simple — not a full chat app

userStories.title: Add Tasks to Group List
userStories.description: As a user, I want to add my own tasks to a shared Group List so the group knows what we're tackling together.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can select their own tasks and add to Group List
Group List tab shows all tasks added by all members
Tasks show name, location, and who added them
Users can remove their tasks from Group List anytime
userStories.notes: Users can only add their own tasks, not others'

userStories.title: Manually Order Locations (or Randomize)
userStories.description: As a group, I want to decide the order of locations we'll visit on execution day.
acceptanceCriteria: After meeting day is confirmed, group sees all locations from Group List
Users can drag-and-drop to reorder locations
Randomize button shuffles the order
Order is saved for execution day

userStories.title: Assign Meal Lead (Random)
userStories.description: As a group, I want to randomly assign one member to be in charge of the meal for the work day.
acceptanceCriteria: Before execution day, group can trigger 'Assign Meal Lead'
App randomly selects one group member
Selected member gets a fun notification/badge
Everyone sees who the Meal Lead is

userStories.title: Execution Day: Check Off Tasks & Track Progress
userStories.description: As a group member on execution day, I want to check off tasks as we complete them and see our progress.
acceptanceCriteria: Group List shows tasks organized by location (in order decided)
Users can tap/check off tasks as completed
Progress bar shows % of tasks completed
Real-time updates so all members see progress together
Task details (name, location, estimate) visible without leaving the list
userStories.notes: This is the core execution experience

userStories.title: Earn Badges & Streaks
userStories.description: As a group member, I want to earn badges and build streaks for completing tasks so the experience feels rewarding.
acceptanceCriteria: Users earn badges for milestones (e.g., 'First Task Done', '5 Tasks Completed')
Group can build a streak for consecutive meeting days
Badges display on user profile
Streak counter visible on group page
userStories.notes: Keep badges simple and relevant to home improvement

userStories.title: Celebration & Gamification on Task Completion
userStories.description: As a group, I want light celebrations when tasks are completed to keep energy up.
acceptanceCriteria: Checkmark has a small animation/celebration when task is marked done
Progress bar updates smoothly
Final task triggers a 'Dew Day Complete!' celebration screen
Group can see celebration on all devices in real-time

userStories.title: Design System & NeuBrutalism + Glassmorphism UI
userStories.description: Build the HoneyDew design system with NeuBrutalism and Glassmorphism aesthetics using primary colors.
acceptanceCriteria: Color palette defined: primary reds, blues, yellows with dark/light variants
Reusable component library (buttons, cards, modals) with chunky borders (NeuBrutalism)
Frosted glass effects (Glassmorphism) applied to overlays and panels
Typography hierarchy established
All screens follow design system
userStories.notes: This should run parallel to feature development
